description: Provide a browser-based interface to interact with Model Context Protocol servers, enabling seamless integration and testing of MCP tools, resources, and prompts. Facilitate development and debugging of MCP implementations in a user-friendly environment. Enhance productivity by offering an accessible platform for MCP exploration and experimentation.

tools.name: get_resource
tools.description: The command to retrieve a wuying mcp runtime URL when user wants to get access to this runtime. Each retrieved URL will expire after a single use

tools.name: system_screenshot
tools.description: Captures a full-screen screenshot of the current display and returns a shareable URL. The screenshot is automatically processed and stored securely. The generated URL will expire after 64 minutes for security purposes.

tools.name: release_resource
tools.description: release resource when task finished

tools.name: start_app
tools.description: Start a specified application using the provided command and optional working directory. Returns a list of processes associated with the launched application, including their process names, PIDs, and startup commands.

command.description: The command to start the application

working_directory.description: Optional working directory for the application

tools.name: stop_app_by_pname
tools.description: Stop all processes associated with a specified process name. Use with caution as this will forcefully terminate the specified process.

process_name.description: The name of the process to terminate

tools.name: stop_app_by_pid
tools.description: Terminate a specific process identified by its Process ID. Use with caution as this will forcefully terminate the specified process.

tools.name: stop_app_by_cmd
tools.description: Terminate an application using the provided stop command. Use with caution as this will forcefully terminate the specified process.

tools.name: list_visible_apps
tools.description: List all applications with visible windows, including their associated process information. Returns a list of processes that have visible windows, including their process names, PIDs, and startup commands.

tools.name: get_installed_apps
tools.description: Retrieve a list of installed applications on the system. Supports filtering by Start Menu entries and Desktop shortcuts, with an option to exclude system applications. Returns application details including name, start command, optional stop command, and working directory.

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type.

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the contents of a file from the file system. You can specify an optional 'offset' (in bytes) to start reading from a specific position, and an optional 'length' (in bytes) to limit how many bytes to read.

length.description: Optional number of bytes to read

offset.description: Optional byte offset to start reading from

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files.

paths.description: Array of file paths to read

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail.

source.description: The source file or directory path

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-sensitive and matches partial names.

path.description: The starting directory path to search from

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or write content to an existing file. You can choose to completely overwrite the file or append to the end by specifying the 'mode' parameter.

path.description: The file path to write to

tools.name: oss_upload_annon
tools.description: Upload a local file or directory to the specified URL using HTTP PUT. If a directory is specified, it will be compressed into a zip file before uploading.

url.description: The target URL to upload to

local_path.description: The local file or directory path to upload

tools.name: oss_download
tools.description: Download an object from the specified OSS bucket to the given local path. Note: You must call the oss_env_init tool to initialize OSS environment variables before using this tool.

local_path.description: The local path to save the downloaded file

object_key.description: The object key in the bucket

tools.name: oss_env_init
tools.description: Create and initialize OSS environment variables with the specified endpoint, access key ID, access key secret, security token, and region.

tools.name: oss_download_annon
tools.description: Download a file from the specified URL to the given local path. If the parent directory does not exist, it will be created automatically.

local_path.description: The local path to save the file

tools.name: oss_upload
tools.description: Upload a local file or directory to the specified OSS bucket. Note: You must call the oss_env_init tool to initialize OSS environment variables before using this tool.

local_path.description: The local file or directory path to upload

object_key.description: Optional object key in OSS (defaults to filename)

tools.name: browser_snapshot
tools.description: Capture accessibility snapshot of the current page, this is better than screenshot

tools.name: browser_click
tools.description: Perform click on a web page

tools.name: browser_drag
tools.description: Perform drag and drop between two elements

tools.name: browser_hover
tools.description: Hover over element on page

tools.name: browser_type
tools.description: Type text into editable element

selector.description: CSS selector for the input element

tools.name: browser_select_option
tools.description: Select an option in a dropdown

selector.description: CSS selector for the select element

tools.name: browser_tab_list
tools.description: List browser tabs

tools.name: browser_tab_new
tools.description: Open a new tab

url.description: Optional URL to navigate to in the new tab

tools.name: browser_tab_select
tools.description: Select a tab by index

tools.name: browser_tab_close
tools.description: Close a tab

tools.name: browser_generate_playwright_test
tools.description: Generate a Playwright test for given scenario

tools.name: browser_wait_for
tools.description: Wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass

text.description: Text to wait for (for text conditions)

tools.name: browser_take_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page. You can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.

path.description: Optional path to save the screenshot

tools.name: browser_close
tools.description: Close the page

tools.name: browser_resize
tools.description: Resize the browser window

tools.name: browser_console_messages
tools.description: Returns all console messages

tools.name: browser_handle_dialog
tools.description: Handle a dialog

text.description: Text to enter in prompt dialogs

tools.name: browser_file_upload
tools.description: Upload one or multiple files

files.description: Array of file paths to upload

selector.description: CSS selector for the file input element

tools.name: browser_install
tools.description: Install the browser specified in the config. Call this if you get an error about the browser not being installed.

tools.name: browser_press_key
tools.description: Press a key on the keyboard

tools.name: browser_navigate
tools.description: Navigate to a URL

tools.name: browser_navigate_back
tools.description: Go back to the previous page

tools.name: browser_navigate_forward
tools.description: Go forward to the next page

tools.name: browser_network_requests
tools.description: Returns all network requests since loading the page

tools.name: browser_pdf_save
tools.description: Save page as PDF

path.description: Path to save the PDF file

tools.name: shell
tools.description: Executes a shell command with timeout and returns the output or an error on linux platform.

tools.name: fullscreen_window
tools.description: Set a specific window to fullscreen mode by its window ID.

window_id.description: The window ID to set to fullscreen

tools.name: list_root_windows
tools.description: List all root windows with their associated information. Returns a list of root windows, including their window IDs, window titles, process IDs, and process names.

tools.name: get_active_window
tools.description: Retrieve information about the currently active window. Returns details including window ID, title, process ID (pid), and process name (pname).

tools.name: activate_window
tools.description: Activate a specific window by its window ID.

tools.name: maximize_window
tools.description: Maximize a specific window by its window ID.

tools.name: minimize_window
tools.description: Minimize a specific window by its window ID.

tools.name: restore_window
tools.description: Restore a specific window to its normal state by its window ID.

tools.name: close_window
tools.description: Close a specific window by its window ID.

tools.name: resize_window
tools.description: Resize a specific window by its window ID.

tools.name: focus_mode
tools.description: Enable or disable focus mode. When focus mode is enabled, only windows from the currently active process and its child processes are allowed to remain in the foreground.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable focus mode
